intro: Diplolophium africanum, commonly known as the African devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
